content:
TRUE. Kerry Washington was conceived via an anonymous sperm donor[1][2]. The actress revealed this information publicly in conjunction with the release of her 2023 memoir, *Thicker Than Water*, explaining that she only learned the truth herself in 2018 at the age of 41[3][4].

## The Revelation and Its Catalyst

The disclosure of this long-held family secret was triggered by Washington's decision to participate in the PBS series *Finding Your Roots*, hosted by genealogist Dr. Henry Louis "Skip" Gates Jr[1][5]. When her parents, Valerie and Earl Washington, learned the show required DNA samples, they became hesitant[5][6]. Her father, Earl, began suffering from panic attacks, insomnia, and irritability, and her parents considered pulling out of the show[1][7].

At Washington's request, Gates spoke with her parents privately[5][7]. During the call, her mother posed a hypothetical question about whether a sperm donor conception would appear in DNA testing[7]. Gates confirmed it would and encouraged them to tell their daughter the truth while they were all still alive to allow for healing and reconciliation[1][7]. Subsequently, in the spring of 2018, her parents sat her down and revealed that after struggling with fertility issues, they had used an anonymous sperm donor to conceive her[3][8].

### Context of the Conception
Her parents explained that they had tried to conceive for years before her mother's doctor suggested artificial insemination, which was a new and "experimental" procedure in the mid-1970s[9][10]. The practice at the time was "cloaked in secrecy and shame," with only a few doctors in Manhattan performing it[11][10]. The doctor instructed her parents to have intercourse after the procedure to provide "plausible deniability" regarding her paternity[9][10]. Their plan had been to take the secret "to their grave," with her mother considering leaving a note in a safe deposit box for Washington to find after her death[5][6].

## Impact on Kerry Washington and Her Family

### Emotional and Psychological Impact
Washington described her reaction as a mix of shock, liberation, and curiosity, stating, "When I got this information, I was like, 'Oh. I now know my story'"[1][12]. The news provided a "confirmation" for a lifelong "weird disconnect" she had felt with her father, which she had previously blamed on herself[1][13]. She has since connected this "dissonance" of not knowing the truth about her body to past struggles with an eating disorder, anxiety, and self-esteem issues[5][14].

### Relationship with Her Father, Earl Washington
At the moment of the revelation, Washington observed that her father, Earl, seemed "terrified" that she would no longer consider him her dad[7]. She immediately reassured him, realizing that every time she had previously said "I love you," he may have believed it was conditional on the lie of his paternity[15]. She told him, "You are going to have a chance now to know what it feels like to be loved unconditionally"[7]. The experience has ultimately deepened their relationship, making it more honest and transparent[7][16]. While her parents were initially "not thrilled" about her writing the memoir, they became supportive throughout the process[14][17]. Earl Washington has since stated that while it is not the book he would have written, he supports her and understands why it was important for her journey[18].

### The Memoir and Public Disclosure
The revelation became the central narrative of her memoir, *Thicker Than Water*, released in September 2023[3][19]. She had originally sold a book idea based on life lessons from her role as Olivia Pope on *Scandal*, but found it "impossible" to write that book after learning the truth about her origins[1]. She even tried to return the publisher's advance before agreeing to write about her personal journey instead[5][20].

Washington is now actively searching for the identity of the donor, whom she prefers to call "the donor" rather than her "biological father," as she does not yet know what kind of relationship, if any, they might have[10][21]. She remains firm that Earl Washington is, and always will be, her dad[22].
